oai_dc:dc.dc:title: North Carolina land warrant
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: North Carolina land warrant for 5,760 acres of land in Davidson County to Colonel Samuel Lockart, 1787 (Hand copy of original. Original probably in North Carolina.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Revolutions; Land;
United States--History--Revolution, 1775-1783; Land grants - North Carolina; Land titles
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: After the Revolutionary War, the federal government awarded bounty lands to citizens and soldiers for services rendered, often as the exchange of free land for military service.
